p: Given a cohort of C. krombeini eggs under constant temperatures, the predicted daily frequency (%) of adult emergence was presented in relation to temperature (°C) and time (day) ( Fig 4). The predicted values showed that adult emergence of C. krombeini would occur earlier at the optimum temperature in much shorter time but the adult emergence at both ends of temperatures would occur later over extended periods. From a cohort of C. krombeini eggs, for instance, the adult emergence would occur in 8–10 days at 34°C, whereas it would take 70–84 days at 12°C and 21–25 days at 37°C.
